title: Large memory usage in codegen, probably due to symbol names

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: I-compilemem
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to memory usage during compilation.

body:
My crate (around 1000 lines of code) composes streams, futures, closures and other types without type erasure through `impl Trait` return values and associated types (thanks to `type_alias_impl_trait`). The resulting symbol names quickly reach rustc-demangle's 1 million character limit, and the whole build uses 7GB, see this extract of a run with `-Ztime-passes`:

```
[…]
time:   0.000; rss:  329MB ->  329MB (   +0MB)  find_cgu_reuse
time: 110.308; rss:  327MB -> 7141MB (+6814MB)  codegen_to_LLVM_IR
time: 244.762; rss:  179MB -> 7141MB (+6962MB)  codegen_crate
time:   0.000; rss: 7141MB -> 7141MB (   +0MB)  serialize_dep_graph
[…]
```

This is with `symbol-mangling-version=v0`, `incremental = false`, `lto = true`, `opt-level > 0` and `debug = 0`. Wwithout any of these options rustc is killed on my machine at 12GB usage.
